sen.j: 綱吉並びにその母である桂昌院の散財、生類憐みの令の採用等と相俟って先代家綱の頃からの慢性的な財政赤字は、先述のように悪化していった。
sen.e: As the chronic budget deficits since the age of the precedent shogun Ietsuna worsened as stated above due to splurges by Tsunayoshi and his mother Keishoin as well as due to adoption of Shorui Awaremi-no-rei, the bakufu appointed Shigehide OGIWARA Kanjoginmiyaku (a post of the Edo bakufu to support commissioners at the finance ministry) (later kanjo gubyo, or commissioner of finance) and gained profit from issuance of currency (seignoirage) by issuing Genroku Koban (oval coin), but caused inflation, which burdened the common people's life.

As the chronic budget deficits since the age of the precedent shogun Ietsuna worsened as mentioned above due to the splurges by Tsunayoshi and his mother Keishoin, as well as due to the enforcement of Shorui Awareminorei.

sen.e: The above-mentioned worsening of the chronic budget deficit that had been built up since the rule of Ietsuna, the previous shogun, was due to the excessive spending by Tsunayoshi and his mother Keishoin, as well as the enforcement of the Shorui Awareminorei.

sen.j: その為、勘定吟味役（後に勘定奉行）に荻原重秀を登用し、元禄小判を行い、幕府は貨幣発行益（シニョレージ（seigniorage））を得たけれども、インフレーションを招き庶民の生活を苦しめることとなった。

tit.j: 徳川家宣・徳川家継の時代（正徳の治）
tit.e: Age of Ienobu and Ietsugu TOKUGAWA (Shotoku-no-chi, or the peaceful era of Shotoku)
Ages of Ienobu and Ietsugu TOKUGAWA (Shotoku no chi [the peaceful era of Shotoku])

sen.j: 徳川綱吉に後継となる男子が生まれなかった為、甥の甲府藩主徳川家宣が6代将軍に次いで、7代将軍に幼児の徳川家継が就任する。
sen.e: As Tsunayoshi TOKUGAWA had no son who could succeed him, the lord of the Kofu domain Ienobu TOKUGAWA, who was his nephew, became the sixth shogun and after Ienobu, Ietsugu TOKUGAWA, still an infant, assumed the post of the seventh shogun.

sen.j: この時期は将軍が病弱･幼年ということもあり、間部詮房や朱子学者である新井白石が政治を主宰した。
sen.e: In this period Akifusa MANABE and a Neo-Confucian scholar Hakuseki ARAI led the government because shogun were weak and immature.
In this period Akifusa MANABE and a Neo-Confucian scholar Hakuseki ARAI led the government because the shogun was weak and immature.
In this period Akifusa MANABE and a Neo-Confucian scholar Hakuseki ARAI led the government because the shogun was weak and immature.

sen.j: この政権の課題は、将軍が短命･幼弱ということもあり、「如何にして将軍個人の人格よりも将軍職の地位とその権威を高めるか」であり、綱吉の頃と同様、朱子学の影響を受けた政策と言える。
sen.e: The challenge of this government was "how to enhance the status and authority of shogunate, regardless of shogun's own personalities," considering a short life or immaturity of shogun, and the policies were under the influence of Neo-Confucianism just as in the age of Tsunayoshi.

sen.j: 新井白石は家宣が将軍就任後すぐに、生類憐みの令を廃止し、側用人の柳沢吉保を罷免した。
sen.e: Immediately after Ienobu assumed the post of shogun, Hakuseki ARAI abolished Shorui Awaremi-no-rei and dismissed Yoshiyasu YANAGISAWA, sobayonin.

sen.e: And in order to resolve the government's challenge, he first decided to use the authority of the Imperial Family (by establishing the Kaninnomiya family and fixing the engagement between a daughter of the Emperor Reigen, Imperial Princess Yoshiko and Ietsugu TOKUGAWA).

sen.e: Second, considering great import excess in the trade between Holland and Japan (which meant that gold and silver were drained out of Japan; and the outflow of gold and silver decreased the amount of domestic currency circulation and cooled down the economy because currency was backed up by the existence of gold and silver), the bakufu issued Kaihakugoshi shinrei or Nagasaki shinrei (a law enacted in order to limit amount of international trade) in 1715, restricting the trade between Holland and Japan.

The second action, which was taken concerning about Japan's import surplus through the trade in Nagasaki, was restricting the international trade through Nagasaki by issuing a new law in 1715 to limit the amount of international trade called 'Kaihakugoshi shinrei' or 'Nagasaki shinrei' (which meant that gold and silver were drained out of Japan; and the outflow of gold and silver meant the decrease of the domestic circulation of money and eventually indicated the risk of cooling economy because the currency was backed by the amount of gold and silver at that time).

sen.j: 江戸幕府の財源は米に依拠しているにもかかわらず、米価がその他の物価に対し相対的に下落していく傾向を放置した状態であり、4～7代将軍の頃には解決できず、徳川吉宗の享保の改革を待つこととなる。
sen.e: Though the Edo bakufu relied on rice for its source of funds, the tendency of the rice price to fall relative to prices of other commodities was left unsolved, and this tendency was not stopped in the period from the fourth to the seventh shogun, until the Kyoho reforms by Yoshimune TOKUGAWA.

Although the Edo bakufu relied on rice for its source of funds, the downward move of rice price in relation to the prices of other commodities was left unsolved, and this tendency was not stopped even in the ages of the fourth to the seventh shogun, and the solution had to be wait until the Kyoho reforms by Yoshimune TOKUGAWA.

Although the Edo bakufu relied on rice for its source of funds, the fall in the price of rice in relation to the prices of other commodities went unresolved from the reign of the fourth shogun through to that of the seventh; the issue was finally resolved by the Kyoho reforms introduced by Yoshimune TOKUGAWA.
